results.title: Who pays the fiddler?
results.brief_description: An open-ended dramatisation dealing with the conflicts and decisions facing a young unmarried couple who discover that the girl is pregnant. Designed to stimulate discussion on love, emotional maturity, casual sex, and abortion.

results.title: Who needs the computer?
results.creator_credit: Peter Bradford, EMI/Parlophone, Bill Sewell and Philip Harland
results.brief_description: An animated film designed to explore some of the common misconceptions about the computer. Suitable for senior management, computer users, systems analysts and trainees and is intended to form a sound basis for subsequent group discussions.

results.title: Who needs rules?
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Gregory Heimer
results.brief_description: This film shows the wide range of rules of society, from everyday rules to the complex rules of law. Gives two examples: two children decide whether or not to keep a stray dog in an apartment prohibiting animals; and a boy involved in a playground row is torn between the school rule against fighting and his father’s order to defend himself. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Who needs a wash?
results.creator_credit: Royal Society for the Protection of Birds and Hugh Miles
results.brief_description: A passionate and ecological film for the defence of ‘The Wash’. ‘The Wash’ is an estuary mud flat up to five miles wide that is washed by tides from the North Sea. Many birds and sea creatures call ‘The Wash’ home, or a t least a resting place. Flora abounds on the land edges. Acre for acre there is more protein in tidal mud banks than in reclaimed grain fields. Proposed fresh water reservoirs may pose a threat to wildlife.

results.title: Who knows? = Va Savoir
results.creator_credit: Martine Marignac, Pierre Grise, Artificial Eye, Canal+ and Jacques Rivette
results.brief_description: Urbane theatre is the setting for Jacques Rivette’s romantic comedy, revolving around the love affairs (past and present) of six individuals. When Camille returns to Paris to star in a new play she is reunited with a soon-to-be-married old flame; meanwhile her director/lover becomes intrigued by an ingenue who is assisting him locate a long-lost Italian play, whose brother is swindling a vulnerable woman. In this droll work, Rivette contentedly draws on the “life is art” theme, whilst the leisurely pace allows his protagonists to explore their entanglements with an appealing mix of contemplation and whimsy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martine Marignac, Pierre Grise, Artificial Eye, Canal+ and Jacques Rivette

results.creator_credit: Peter Dimond, South Australian Film Corporation and Eric Fullilove
results.brief_description: An open-ended training session for prison officers. Deals with a number of prisoner behavioural problems. Cast includes Bill Charlton, FranklGallacher, Rob George, John Clayton, Lloyd Cunnington, Maureen Sherlock, Barbara West, Susan Wylie.

results.title: Who killed the sale?
results.creator_credit: Michael Tuchner, Anthony Pelissier, Ian Latimer and Rank Organisation Short Films Group
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Customer and You”.
An amusing film in Cleese style of a case study which shows that employees in all parts of a company can affect a company’s ability to get and to keep business. With Bud Tingwell.

results.title: Who Killed Target 1967?
results.brief_description: A vengeful female scientist, outraged by Godard’s victimisation of Anna Karina, constructs a beautiful female robot to seduce and destroy lovers attracted solely by physical beauty.

results.title: Who killed Jenny Langby?
results.creator_credit: John Morris, South Australian Film Corporation and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: An award winning portrayal by director Donald Crombie of a suburban mother who is a victim of the pressures and pace of modern urban life. The domestic situation before and after her suicide are re-created for a dramatic examination of cause and effect. Docu-drama presented as an interview by Anne Deveson.

results.title: Who killed Dr Bogle and Mrs Chandler?
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Blackwattle Films, Peter Butt and Kristine Wyld
results.brief_description: At last, an answer to one of the greatest unsolved cases in Australian crime history. When the bodies of brilliant physicist Dr Gilbert Bogle and his lover Mrs Margaret Chandler were found in bizarre circumstances on a Sydney riverbank in 1963, it captured the public imagination and launched an unprecedented murder investigation. However, the Coroner could find no cause of death, killer or motive. Some suggested it was a Cold War assassination, others claimed it was an overdose of LSD. Now, four decades later, a re-investigation of the case and uncovers explosive new evidence. Narrated by Hugo Weaving. Cast includes Rhys Muldoon, Octavia Barron-Martin and Nicholas Hope.
